capability.name: Economic Capital
capability.definition: Economic Capital capability provides comprehensive risk consolidation across different risk types to determine the bank's overall risk position. It develops and maintains sophisticated models that integrate various risk categories to provide a complete picture of the institution's risk exposure.
capability.role: Develop, maintain and apply models that combine the overall risk over different risk types to determine the consolidated risk position for the bank
capability.example: Financial engineers define and apply models that consolidate the overall risk exposure for the bank to determine a complete estimate of exposure
